qas.question: What did the biggest star on the flag of China in 1949 represent?
In the mid 20th century the flag of Laos was primarily what color?
What does the red color in the Nepalese flag represent?
In what year during the 20th century did the Chinese flag become red?
Which group gained power in China in 1949?
Who took power in China in 1994?

plausible_answers.text: a red flag with a large star

qas.question: What flag symbolizing China was displayed in 1949?

plausible_answers.text: other Communist regimes such as Vietnam and Laos also adopted red flags

qas.question: What country decided to keep their old flag in 1960?

context: After <a4_0>the <b5_0>Communist Party of China<b5_0/><a4_0/> took power in <a3_0>1949<a3_0/>, the flag of China became <b6_0>a red flag with a large star<b6_0/> symbolizing <a0_0>the Communist Party<a0_0/>, and smaller stars symbolizing workers, peasants, the urban middle class and rural middle class. The flag of the Communist Party of China became a red banner with a hammer and sickle, similar to that on the Soviet flag. In the 1950s and 1960s, <b7_0>other Communist regimes such as Vietnam and Laos also adopted <a1_0>red<a1_0/> flags<b7_0/>. Some Communist countries, such as <b8_0>Cuba<b8_0/>, chose to keep their old flags; and other countries used red flags which had nothing to do with Communism or socialism; the red flag of Nepal, for instance, represents <a2_0>the national flower<a2_0/>.
